notes.text: The riper the bananas, the better. Add walnuts or chocolate chips for variety. Test with a skewer - it should come out clean.

steps.descr: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F), grease a loaf tin

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by preheating the oven to 175°C. Make sure to grease your loaf tin so nothing sticks!

steps.instructions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F), grease a loaf tin

steps.descr: Mix mashed banana with melted butter

on_enter.say: Now, let's mix those lovely mashed bananas with the melted butter. It should smell delicious already!

steps.instructions: Mix mashed banana with melted butter

steps.descr: Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now stir in the sugar, egg, and vanilla. Give it a good mix until everything's well combined.

steps.instructions: Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla

on_enter.say: Let's add a pinch of salt and the baking soda. This will help our bread rise beautifully.

steps.descr: Fold in flour until just combined

on_enter.say: Gently fold in the flour until it's just combined. We don't want to overmix it.

steps.instructions: Fold in flour until just combined

steps.descr: Pour into tin and bake 50-60 minutes

on_enter.say: Pour the batter into your prepared tin and pop it in the oven. We'll bake it for about 50 to 60 minutes until it's beautifully golden and cooked through.

steps.instructions: Pour into tin and bake 50-60 minutes

steps.descr: Cool in tin 10 minutes, then on a wire rack

on_enter.say: Once it's out of the oven, let it cool in the tin for about 10 minutes. Then, transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely. The aroma is going to be irresistible!

steps.instructions: Cool in tin 10 minutes, then on a wire rack

recipe.title: Banana Bread
recipe.description: Moist, sweet bread perfect for breakfast or snacking
